intro: Chaerophyllum tainturieri, commonly known as the Italian cow parsley. It is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and tall, slender stems that bear small, white or pale yellow flowers. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
